title: Is it bad that I don't feel any guilt when I steal from stores?

I understand why stealing is wrong and immoral, but I just can't bring myself to care if I am taking something that costs $10 from a big corporation.   I would be super devastated if I got caught, but otherwise it doesn't bother me at all.  Anyone else relate?

title: Question about course enrollment/waitlist for students on financial aid.
self_text: I have an issue that’s been troubling me all week so i wanted to reach out and ask a question or advice regarding my situation with course enrollment.   I am a student who is fully dependent on financial aid (grants, scholarships, loans) to cover tuition & fees and other expenses. A couple of weeks ago i enrolled in 17 units and then after the add deadline i dropped down to 12 units due to personal reasons. The reason why this is concerning because if I don't maintain full time status (12+ units), my financial aid will be reduced which is not an option for me.  I was able to get into classes for 15 total units but there are two courses I really want to take but they are currently waitlisted and i don't know when or even if I can enroll as soon as possible. If i don't add these two courses it will leave me at 13 units meaning I won’t be considered full-time and therefore risk losing aid. Has anyone ever dealt with this type of situation before? Any tips on how to stay afloat in regards to being able to keep your financial aid by remaining full time while taking classes you actually need to graduate?   Thank you for reading!

title: CS127 final exam is open book, notes, and internet!
self_text: You can use any material you like during the exam.   This includes notes, textbook, cheat sheets, calculator, code editor, compiler, debugger, web browser to look up information on Google or Stack Overflow, etc.  The only thing you cannot do is communicate with anyone else.   Good luck everyone!
